CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 27, 1952, pg. 2, reads: "Plunged From Attic in Fire - Mrs. Essie Smalls, left, 29, 1824 Rowley Street, and her one-year-old daughter, Anna Belle, are shown recovering in Mercy Hospital this week after Mrs. Smalls, panic-stricken by being trapped in a third floor attic with her child while fire devoured the first floor and licked into her apartment, tossed the infant out the window into a parked truck below and then leaped herself. Her injuries were listed as undetermined.  The child was treated for burns of the hands and legs and head injuries.  A neighbor, Samuel Brown, 1822 Bedford Avenue, led other occupants of the house, including Mrs. Small's other two children, Harrison, 4, and Herbert Lee, 3, from the house. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Anna Belle Smalls with bandaged head and hands, seated in crib in Mercy Hospital, after suffering burns and injuries from being tossed from third floor of her home during fire, another version
